episodeTitle: The Famous Cook! Sanji of the Floating Restaurant
episodeTitleJapanese: 名物コック！海上レストランのサンジ
episodeTitleRomanized: Meibutsu Kokku! Kaijō Resutoran no Sanji
description: The Straw Hats rescue Johnny and Yosaku, former bounty hunters and friends of Zoro. When Yosaku falls ill with scurvy, they set course for the famous floating restaurant Baratie to find a cook. There, they encounter Sanji, a skilled sous chef with a passion for food and powerful leg-based fighting techniques.

events.title: Johnny and Yosaku Debut
events.description: Johnny and Yosaku, former bounty hunting partners of Roronoa Zoro, make their first appearance. Johnny initially attacks the Going Merry in revenge for shooting cannonballs at the island where Yosaku was resting, but stops when Zoro recognizes him.
events.significance: Introduces two supporting characters who served as Zoro's partners before he became a pirate. They provide comic relief and guide the Straw Hats to the Baratie restaurant. Their friendship with Zoro adds depth to his backstory.

quotes.speaker: Johnny
quotes.context: Johnny recognizes Zoro aboard the Going Merry

events.title: Yosaku's Scurvy Diagnosis
events.description: Nami diagnoses Yosaku with scurvy, a disease caused by vitamin C deficiency. She treats him with lime juice, demonstrating her medical knowledge and the importance of proper nutrition at sea.
events.significance: This event highlights the crucial need for a cook on the crew who can provide balanced meals. It serves as the catalyst for the crew seeking out the Baratie restaurant and eventually recruiting Sanji. Also showcases Nami's practical knowledge.

quotes.text: It's scurvy. He needs vitamin C from fruits, especially citrus.
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Nami Sees Arlong's Wanted Poster
events.description: While looking through Johnny's collection of wanted posters, Nami comes across Arlong's bounty poster and reacts with visible distress and anger. She quickly hides her reaction from the crew.
events.significance: This is the first major foreshadowing of Nami's dark connection to the fish-man pirate Arlong. Her emotional reaction hints at a traumatic past that will be revealed in the Arlong Park Arc. This subtle moment plants seeds for one of the series' most emotional storylines.

events.title: Arrival at the Baratie
events.description: The Straw Hat crew arrives at the Baratie, a famous floating restaurant shaped like a fish. The restaurant serves as both a dining establishment and a battleground, attracting pirates, marines, and civilians alike.
events.significance: The Baratie serves as the primary setting for this arc and represents Sanji's world before joining the Straw Hats. The floating restaurant is an iconic location in One Piece, symbolizing dreams and the freedom of the sea.

events.title: Marine Lieutenant Fullbody Arrives
events.description: Marine Lieutenant Fullbody arrives at the Baratie with his date Moodie, attempting to impress her with his knowledge of fine wine. His arrogant attitude and military rank create tension in the restaurant.
events.significance: Fullbody serves as an antagonist who demonstrates Sanji's zero-tolerance policy for wasting food and disrespecting chefs. His presence also shows that the Baratie serves all customers regardless of their allegiance.

events.title: Sanji's First Appearance
events.description: Sanji makes his debut as the sous chef of the Baratie. He is shown as a smooth-talking, chivalrous cook who treats female customers with utmost respect while being dismissive toward male patrons. His passion for cooking and dedication to feeding people is immediately apparent.
events.significance: This is the introduction of the future Straw Hat chef and one of the series' main characters. Sanji's debut establishes his core character traits: his love for cooking, his chivalrous nature toward women, and his fighting prowess using only his legs to preserve his hands for cooking.

quotes.text: I'll never refuse someone who's hungry.
quotes.speaker: Sanji

events.title: Sanji Corrects Fullbody's Wine Knowledge
events.description: When Fullbody tries to show off his wine expertise to impress his date, Sanji politely corrects him, revealing that Fullbody's knowledge is wrong. This humiliates Fullbody in front of Moodie.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's expertise and professionalism as a cook and sommelier. It also sets up the conflict between Sanji and Fullbody that escalates throughout the episode.

events.title: Luffy Deflects Cannonball Into Baratie
events.description: When Marine Lieutenant Fullbody orders his men to attack the Going Merry as it approaches the Baratie, Luffy deflects a cannonball using his rubber powers. However, the deflected cannonball crashes into the Baratie's roof, causing significant damage.
events.significance: This accident sets up Luffy's debt to the Baratie and forces him to work as a chore boy. It creates the circumstances that allow Luffy to observe Sanji and ultimately recruit him. The event also demonstrates consequences for Luffy's reckless actions.

events.title: Zeff's First Appearance
events.description: Zeff, the head chef and owner of the Baratie, makes his debut. He is shown as a stern, commanding presence with a peg leg. He was injured by the falling debris from Luffy's deflected cannonball and demands compensation.
events.significance: Zeff is revealed as the legendary former pirate 'Red-Leg Zeff' and serves as Sanji's father figure and mentor. His introduction sets up his important role in Sanji's backstory and his philosophy about food and dreams. Zeff's character embodies the theme of reformed pirates finding new purposes.

events.title: Luffy Agrees to Work as Chore Boy
events.description: To pay for the damage to the Baratie's roof, Luffy agrees to work as a chore boy for one year. This decision is made despite his crew's protests, showing Luffy's sense of responsibility for his actions.
events.significance: This demonstrates Luffy's character growth and willingness to take responsibility for his mistakes. It also creates the situation where Luffy can observe Sanji's skills and dedication, leading to his decision to recruit him as the crew's cook.

events.title: Fullbody Attacks Sanji
events.description: Humiliated by Sanji's correction about wine and seeking revenge, Lieutenant Fullbody attacks Sanji. He attempts to use his iron knuckle fighting style against the cook.
events.significance: This confrontation reveals Sanji's combat abilities and his fighting philosophy. It sets up the demonstration of Sanji's Black Leg Style fighting techniques.

events.title: Sanji's Black Leg Style Debut
events.description: Sanji effortlessly defeats Lieutenant Fullbody using his signature leg-based fighting style, never using his hands in combat. He delivers a devastating kick that sends Fullbody flying, demonstrating his incredible leg strength and fighting technique.
events.significance: This is the first display of Sanji's unique fighting style, which uses only kicks to preserve his hands for cooking. The Black Leg Style becomes Sanji's signature combat technique throughout the series. This moment establishes Sanji as not just a cook, but a formidable fighter.

events.title: Sanji's Philosophy on Wasting Food
events.description: After Fullbody spills the soup Sanji prepared, Sanji becomes enraged and beats him severely. Sanji explains that wasting food is absolutely unforgivable, revealing his deep respect for food and those who are hungry.
events.significance: This moment establishes one of Sanji's core character principles: his absolute intolerance for wasting food. This philosophy stems from his traumatic past of nearly starving to death and is a fundamental part of his character throughout the series.

themes.description: The episode introduces Sanji's world at the Baratie and hints at his own dreams and aspirations. The floating restaurant itself represents Zeff's dream realized.
themes.symbolism: The Baratie, a restaurant on the sea, symbolizes the fusion of dreams (adventure) and practical purpose (feeding people).

themes.description: Sanji's absolute intolerance for wasting food establishes one of the series' recurring themes about respecting food and those who hunger.
themes.symbolism: Food represents life, care, and respect for others. Wasting it is shown as a grave offense.
culturalReferences: Japanese cultural values of not wasting food (mottainai)

themes.description: Sanji's respectful treatment of women and his professional code as a cook demonstrate his strong personal code of honor.
themes.symbolism: Sanji's refusal to use his hands in combat symbolizes his dedication to his craft as a cook.

themes.description: Luffy's willingness to work for a year to pay for the damage he caused shows character growth and acceptance of responsibility.
themes.symbolism: The damaged roof represents the consequences of reckless actions.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the interactions between Sanji and Fullbody for dramatic effect.
The anime adds more detail to Johnny and Yosaku's reunion with Zoro.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Sanji, who becomes the fifth member of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the series' most popular characters.
Hiroaki Hirata, Sanji's Japanese voice actor, has voiced the character for over 20 years since this episode aired in 2000.
The episode adapts chapters 42-43 of the original manga, which were part of Volume 5.
The Baratie arc, which begins with this episode, is considered by many fans to be the first 'true' arc of One Piece, establishing the pattern of story arcs that the series would follow.
The foreshadowing of Nami's connection to Arlong in this episode is a subtle example of Eiichiro Oda's long-term planning, as the Arlong Park Arc wouldn't begin until episode 31.
Sanji's fighting style of using only his legs is based on the principle that a chef's hands are sacred and should never be used for violence.
